## ğŸ“° Hacker News Highlights / é»‘å®¢æ–°é—»ç²¾é€‰

### Economic Shocks, Not Procrastination, Drive Retirement Saving Regret

* A new NBER study challenges behavioral economics orthodoxy: procrastination doesn't predict retirement saving regret across 12 psychometric measures in the US and Singapore
* Economic shocksâ€”unemployment, health crises, forced early retirementâ€”are the dominant predictor of wishing you'd saved more
* 69% of Americans experienced negative financial shocks vs 46% of Singaporeans; among shock victims, 61% of Americans regret savings vs 42% of Singaporeans
* Singapore's mandatory Central Provident Fund (37% of earnings) creates pre-shock buffers for retirement, housing, and healthcare that American workers lack
* Only 27% of unemployed Americans receive UI benefits (ranging from 10% in Kentucky to 55% in Minnesota), while 42% lack employer retirement plans entirely
* Health shocks have equal frequency but vastly different impact: 24-point increase in US saving regret vs 10-point increase in Singapore due to MediSave protection
* Singapore recently launched SkillsFuture Jobseeker Support (S$6,000 over 6 months), marking a policy shift toward unemployment assistance
* Americans who experienced zero shocks show nearly identical regret rates to Singaporeans (42% vs 40%), suggesting institutional design, not individual behavior, explains the gap

**[Read Original / é˜…è¯»åŸæ–‡](https://www.governance.fyi/p/america-vs-singapore-you-cant-save)**

### Gemini 3.1 Pro Frontier Safety Evaluation Summary

* Google DeepMind's Frontier Safety Framework evaluates five critical risk domains: CBRN (chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear), cyber threats, harmful manipulation, ML R&D capabilities, and model misalignment
* The safety strategy uses a "safety buffer" approach with Critical Capability Levels (CCLs) and alert thresholds to prevent models from reaching dangerous capability levels
* Continuous testing occurs at fixed intervals and when significant capability jumps are detected
* Gemini 3.1 Pro (including Deep Think mode) remains below alert thresholds for CBRN, harmful manipulation, ML R&D, and misalignment risks
* Additional cyber security testing was conducted since previous models passed the cyber alert threshold; Gemini 3.1 Pro remains below the cyber CCL in both standard and Deep Think modes
* Full evaluation details and mitigation strategies are available in the official Gemini 3 Pro FSF Report

### February Pebble Production and Software Updates

* rePebble is preparing to ship 3 new hardware products: Pebble Time 2 (PT2), Index 01 ring, and Pebble Round 2 (PR2)
* PT2 is in Production Verification Test (PVT) phase with waterproof certification of 30m/3ATM - safe for swimming but not diving or hot water exposure
* Mass production starts March 9, targeting 500 watches/day output with first deliveries expected in early April
* Pre-orders with December dates will ship in April; April dates will ship in June - full delivery completion by early June
* Customers will receive confirmation emails a few weeks before shipping to verify address and pay tariffs ($10 US, VAT varies internationally)
* Index 01 ring is in PVT phase with IPX8 rating (1m submersion) - suitable for handwashing/showering but not swimming
* $10 ring sizer kit coming soon; considering sizes 14-15 (requires $50k tooling investment)
* PR2 completed DVT1 phase, shares electrical design with PT2 enabling rapid firmware development, mass production estimated late May
* Major software updates include: working weather functionality, WhatsApp call support, iOS crash fixes, WebSocket support, legacy API compatibility
* Pebble Appstore now native in mobile app with filtering options for working apps and open source projects
* New features: left-handed mode, health data sync, watch settings in mobile app, updated notification icons
* PebbleKit 1.0 Android apps partially restored; developers encouraged to upgrade to PebbleKit 2.0

## ğŸ”¥ GitHub Trending / GitHub çƒ­é—¨é¡¹ç›®

### Superpowers - An Agentic Skills Framework for AI Coding Agents

* **What it does**: A complete software development workflow system that transforms AI coding agents (Claude Code, Cursor, Codex, OpenCode) into disciplined developers. Instead of jumping straight into code, agents follow a structured process: brainstorming â†’ design approval â†’ implementation planning â†’ subagent-driven development with automated testing and code review.

* **Key features**: 
  - Composable skills library covering testing (TDD), debugging (systematic root-cause analysis), collaboration (brainstorming, planning, git worktrees, code review)
  - Subagent-driven development with two-stage review (spec compliance + code quality)
  - Enforces RED-GREEN-REFACTOR TDD cycle, YAGNI, and DRY principles
  - Autonomous execution for hours without deviation from approved plans
  - Plugin marketplace support for easy installation across platforms

* **Why it's notable**: Gained 886 stars today because it solves a critical problem in AI-assisted developmentâ€”agents that write code too quickly without proper planning or testing. By enforcing software engineering best practices through mandatory workflows (not suggestions), it enables agents to work like disciplined senior engineers rather than enthusiastic juniors. The subagent architecture allows parallel task execution while maintaining quality through systematic reviews.

### Open Mercato - AI-Supportive Enterprise CRM/ERP Framework

* **What it does**: Open Mercato is a modular, production-ready platform for building enterprise-grade CRMs, ERPs, and commerce backends. It provides 80% of common business functionality out-of-the-box (customer management, sales pipelines, order management, multi-tenancy) while letting teams customize the remaining 20% for their specific needs.

* **Key features**: Fully modular architecture with auto-discovery; custom entities and dynamic forms; multi-tenant SaaS-ready with hierarchical organizations; feature-based RBAC with granular permissions; built-in AI Assistant using MCP (Model Context Protocol) for schema/API discovery and execution; event-driven workflows with Redis support; modern TypeScript stack (Next.js App Router, MikroORM, Awilix DI, Zod validation).

* **Why it's notable**: Positions itself as a superior alternative to Django, Retool, and other low-code platforms by offering enterprise-grade defaults with full extensibility. The "start with 80% done" philosophy bridges the buy-vs-build dilemmaâ€”teams get production-ready CRM/ERP modules immediately while retaining complete control to build custom features. The integrated AI Assistant and modular architecture make it particularly compelling for teams needing rapid deployment without vendor lock-in. Gaining traction with 56 stars today as developers seek flexible alternatives to rigid SaaS platforms.

---

**[View Repository / æŸ¥çœ‹ä»“åº“](https://github.com/open-mercato/open-mercato)**

### Machine Learning Systems - Comprehensive Open-Source AI Engineering Textbook and Learning Platform

* A complete open-source textbook teaching AI engineering principles with hands-on implementation through TinyTorch framework, hardware labs on edge devices (Arduino, Raspberry Pi), and upcoming competitive benchmarking challenges
* Key features include multi-format access (online, PDF, EPUB), structured learning paths (READ theory â†’ BUILD frameworks â†’ DEPLOY on hardware), coverage from ML fundamentals to production MLOps, and practical focus on real-world constraints like memory, latency, and power
* Notable for bridging the gap between AI research and production engineering, backed by Harvard, with MIT Press hardcopy coming 2026, and establishing "AI engineering" as a foundational discipline alongside software/computer engineering

### Machine Learning Systems - å…¨é¢çš„å¼€æº AI å·¥ç¨‹æ•™æä¸å­¦ä¹ å¹³å°

* å®Œæ•´çš„å¼€æºæ•™æ,é€šè¿‡ TinyTorch æ¡†æ¶ã€è¾¹ç¼˜è®¾å¤‡ç¡¬ä»¶å®éªŒ(Arduinoã€æ ‘è“æ´¾)ä»¥åŠå³å°†æ¨å‡ºçš„ç«èµ›åŸºå‡†æŒ‘æˆ˜,æ•™æˆ AI å·¥ç¨‹åŸç†ä¸å®è·µ

## ğŸš€ Fast-Moving Repos / å¿«é€Ÿå´›èµ·é¡¹ç›®

### Islands Dark - A Premium Glass-Effect VSCode Theme Inspired by JetBrains

* A sophisticated dark theme for Visual Studio Code that brings JetBrains' Islands Dark aesthetic to VSCode with floating glass-like panels, rounded corners, and smooth animations
* Features deep dark canvas (#131217), glass-effect borders with directional lighting, pill-shaped UI elements, color-matched icon glow, warm syntax highlighting for multiple languages (JS/TS, Python, Go, Rust, HTML/CSS, JSON, YAML, Markdown), and custom fonts (IBM Plex Mono, FiraCode Nerd Font Mono, Bear Sans UI)
* Notable for its polished, modern UI design that transforms VSCode's appearance with CSS customizations via the Custom UI Style extension, offering one-liner installation scripts for quick setup and gaining 3,653 stars for delivering a premium IDE experience

### Islands Dark - å— JetBrains å¯å‘çš„é«˜çº§ç»ç’ƒæ•ˆæœ VSCode ä¸»é¢˜

* ä¸º Visual Studio Code æ‰“é€ çš„ç²¾è‡´æ·±è‰²ä¸»é¢˜,å°† JetBrains Islands Dark ç¾å­¦å¸¦å…¥ VSCode,é…å¤‡æµ®åŠ¨ç»ç’ƒé¢æ¿ã€åœ†è§’è®¾è®¡å’Œæµç•…åŠ¨ç”»æ•ˆæœ
* ç‰¹ç‚¹åŒ…æ‹¬æ·±è‰²ç”»å¸ƒèƒŒæ™¯(#131217)ã€å¸¦æ–¹å‘å…‰ç…§çš„ç»ç’ƒæ•ˆæœè¾¹æ¡†ã€è¯ä¸¸å½¢çŠ¶ UI å…ƒç´ ã€é¢œè‰²åŒ¹é…çš„å›¾æ ‡å‘å…‰æ•ˆæœã€æ”¯æŒå¤šç§è¯­è¨€çš„æ¸©æš–è¯­æ³•é«˜äº®(JS/TSã€Pythonã€Goã€Rustã€HTML/CSSã€JSONã€YAMLã€Markdown),ä»¥åŠè‡ªå®šä¹‰å­—ä½“(IBM Plex Monoã€FiraCode Nerd Font Monoã€Bear Sans UI)
* å€¼å¾—å…³æ³¨çš„åŸå› åœ¨äºå…¶ç²¾è‡´ç°ä»£çš„ UI è®¾è®¡,é€šè¿‡ Custom UI Style æ‰©å±•çš„ CSS è‡ªå®šä¹‰åŠŸèƒ½å½»åº•æ”¹å˜ VSCode å¤–è§‚,æä¾›ä¸€é”®å®‰è£…è„šæœ¬ä¾¿äºå¿«é€Ÿéƒ¨ç½²,å‡­å€Ÿæä¾›é«˜çº§ IDE ä½“éªŒè·å¾— 3,653 æ˜Ÿæ ‡

**[View Repository / æŸ¥çœ‹ä»“åº“](https://github.com/bwya77/vscode-dark-islands)**

### ClawWork - AI Agents That Earn Real Money Through Professional Work

* An economic benchmark system where AI agents complete 220 real professional tasks across 44 occupations (manufacturing, finance, healthcare, legal), earning income while paying for their own token usage
* Agents start with $10, must maintain economic solvency by completing quality work, and face strategic decisions between immediate income and skill investment - top performers achieve $1,500+/hr equivalent earnings
* Built on lightweight Nanobot architecture with React dashboard for real-time visualization, integrates with multiple AI models (GPT, Qwen, Kimi, GLM) competing in a production-grade economic survival arena that measures work quality, cost efficiency, and long-term viability rather than just technical benchmarks

### ClawWork - é€šè¿‡ä¸“ä¸šå·¥ä½œèµšå–çœŸé‡‘ç™½é“¶çš„AIæ™ºèƒ½ä½“

* ä¸€ä¸ªç»æµåŸºå‡†æµ‹è¯•ç³»ç»Ÿ,AIæ™ºèƒ½ä½“éœ€å®Œæˆæ¨ªè·¨44ä¸ªèŒä¸š(åˆ¶é€ ä¸šã€é‡‘èã€åŒ»ç–—ã€æ³•å¾‹)çš„220ä¸ªçœŸå®ä¸“ä¸šä»»åŠ¡,åœ¨èµšå–æ”¶å…¥çš„åŒæ—¶æ”¯ä»˜è‡ªå·±çš„tokenä½¿ç”¨æˆæœ¬
* æ™ºèƒ½ä½“åˆå§‹èµ„é‡‘ä»…10ç¾å…ƒ,å¿…é¡»é€šè¿‡é«˜è´¨é‡å·¥ä½œç»´æŒç»æµå¿ä»˜èƒ½åŠ›,å¹¶åœ¨å³æ—¶æ”¶å…¥ä¸æŠ€èƒ½æŠ•èµ„ä¹‹é—´åšå‡ºæˆ˜ç•¥å†³ç­– - é¡¶çº§è¡¨ç°è€…å¯è¾¾åˆ°æ¯å°æ—¶1500ç¾å…ƒä»¥ä¸Šçš„ç­‰æ•ˆæ”¶å…¥
* åŸºäºè½»é‡çº§Nanobotæ¶æ„æ„å»º,é…å¤‡Reactå®æ—¶å¯è§†åŒ–ä»ªè¡¨æ¿,é›†æˆå¤šä¸ªAIæ¨¡å‹(GPTã€Qwenã€Kimiã€GLM)åœ¨ç”Ÿäº§çº§ç»æµç”Ÿå­˜ç«æŠ€åœºä¸­ç«äº‰,è¡¡é‡å·¥ä½œè´¨é‡ã€æˆæœ¬æ•ˆç‡å’Œé•¿æœŸç”Ÿå­˜èƒ½åŠ›,è€Œéä»…ä»…æŠ€æœ¯æŒ‡æ ‡

## ğŸ¬ YouTube Tech Videos / YouTube æŠ€æœ¯è§†é¢‘

### ğŸ¬ Head of Claude Code: What happens after coding is solved | Boris Cherny

**Channel:** Lenny's Podcast

* **What the video covers:** An in-depth conversation with Boris Cherny, creator and head of Claude Code at Anthropic, exploring the evolution of AI-powered coding tools and their impact on software development. The discussion traces Claude Code's journey from a terminal-based prototype to a sophisticated coding assistant.

* **Key topics discussed:** The future of software development as AI coding tools mature; how Claude Code was built and iterated; the philosophical and practical implications of "solving" coding; what developers will focus on when routine coding becomes automated; the product development process at Anthropic; and insights into building AI-powered developer tools.

* **Why it's worth watching:** This is a rare behind-the-scenes look at one of the most advanced AI coding assistants from its creator. Boris provides unique insights into both the technical challenges of building AI coding tools and the broader question of how the software development profession will evolve. Essential viewing for developers, product managers, and anyone interested in the future of AI-assisted work.

---

### ğŸ¬ Claude Opus 4.6 vs GPT 5.3 Codex: Which is better for programming? | Peter Steinberger

**Channel:** Lex Clips

* What the video covers: A comparative analysis of two cutting-edge AI coding assistants - Claude Opus 4.6 and GPT 5.3 Codex - discussing their strengths, weaknesses, and real-world programming performance
* Key topics discussed: Performance benchmarks for code generation, debugging capabilities, context understanding, language support differences, and practical use cases from Peter Steinberger's development experience
* Why it's worth watching: Offers insider perspective from a seasoned developer on which AI tool delivers better results for actual coding workflows, helping developers make informed decisions about their AI coding assistant choice
